alert.note: Alert for Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 14 at 8:08PM CDT until May 14 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Alabama, including the following counties, Clarke and Washington. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 808 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Saint Stephens, Leroy, Wagarville, Coffeeville, Salitpa, Mays Crossroads, Frankville, Tattlersville, Winn, McVay, Rutan and Toddtown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
